available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

bulkTransfer.name: bulkTransfer
bulkTransfer.comment: Performs a bulk transfer on the specified device. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.bulkTransfer.handle: A connection handle to make the transfer on. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.bulkTransfer.transferInfo: The parameters to the transfer. See GenericTransferInfo. callback: Invoked once the transfer has completed.

claimInterface.name: claimInterface
claimInterface.comment:
Claims an interface on the specified USB device. Before you can transfer data with endpoints, you must claim their parent interfaces. Only one connection handle on the same host can claim each interface. If the interface is already claimed, this call will fail.

You shall call releaseInterface when the interface is not needed anymore.

chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.claimInterface.handle: The device on which the interface is to be claimed. interface: The interface number to be claimed. callback: The callback to invoke once the interface is claimed.

closeDevice.name: closeDevice
closeDevice.comment: Closes a connection handle. Invoking operations on a device after it has been closed is a safe operation, but causes no action to be taken. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.closeDevice.handle: The connection handle to close. callback: The callback to invoke once the device is closed.

controlTransfer.name: controlTransfer
controlTransfer.comment:
Performs a control transfer on the specified device. See the ControlTransferInfo structure for the parameters required to make a transfer.

Conceptually control transfer talks to the device itself. You do not need to claim interface 0 to perform a control transfer.

chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.controlTransfer.handle: A connection handle to make the transfer on. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.controlTransfer.transferInfo: The parameters to the transfer. See ControlTransferInfo. callback: Invoked once the transfer has completed.

findDevices.name: findDevices
findDevices.comment:
Finds USB devices specified by the vendorId/productId/interfaceId tuple and, if permissions allow, opens them for use.

On Chrome OS, you can specify the interfaceId. In that case the method will request access from permission broker in the same way as in requestUsbAcess.

If the access request is rejected, or the device is failed to be opened, its connection handle will not be created or returned.

Calling this method is equivalent to calling chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.getDevices followed by a series of chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.requestAccess (if it is on ChromeOs) and chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.openDevice calls, and returning all the successfully opened connection handles.

chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.findDevices.options: The properties to search for on target devices. callback: Invoked with the opened ConnectionHandle on complete.

getDevices.name: getDevices
getDevices.comment: Lists USB devices specified by vendorId/productId/interfaceId tuple. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.getDevices.options: The properties to search for on target devices. callback: Invoked with a list of chrome/chrome_app.Devices on complete.

interruptTransfer.name: interruptTransfer
interruptTransfer.comment: Performs an interrupt transfer on the specified device. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.interruptTransfer.handle: A connection handle to make the transfer on. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.interruptTransfer.transferInfo: The parameters to the transfer. See GenericTransferInfo. callback: Invoked once the transfer has completed.

isochronousTransfer.name: isochronousTransfer
isochronousTransfer.comment: Performs an isochronous transfer on the specific device. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.isochronousTransfer.handle: A connection handle to make the transfer on. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.isochronousTransfer.transferInfo: The parameters to the transfer. See IsochronousTransferInfo. callback: Invoked once the transfer has been completed.

listInterfaces.name: listInterfaces
listInterfaces.comment: Lists all the interfaces on the USB device. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.listInterfaces.handle: The device from which the interfaces should be listed. callback: The callback to invoke when the interfaces are enumerated.

openDevice.name: openDevice
openDevice.comment: Opens a USB device returned by chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.getDevices. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.openDevice.device: The device to open. callback: Invoked with the created ConnectionHandle on complete.

releaseInterface.name: releaseInterface
releaseInterface.comment: Releases a claim to an interface on the provided device. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.releaseInterface.handle: The device on which the interface is to be released. interface: The interface number to be released. callback: The callback to invoke once the interface is released.

requestAccess.name: requestAccess
requestAccess.comment:
This method is ChromeOS specific. Calling this method on other platforms will fail. Requests access from the permission broker to an OS claimed device if the given interface on the device is not claimed.

chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.requestAccess.device: The device to request access to. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.requestAccess.interfaceId:

resetDevice.name: resetDevice
resetDevice.comment:
Tries to reset the USB device and restores it to the previous status. If the reset fails, the given connection handle will be closed and the USB device will appear to be disconnected then reconnected. In that case you must call chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.getDevices or chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.findDevices again to acquire the device.

chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.resetDevice.handle: A connection handle to reset. callback: Invoked once the device is reset with a boolean indicating whether the reset is completed successfully.

setInterfaceAlternateSetting.name: setInterfaceAlternateSetting
setInterfaceAlternateSetting.comment: Selects an alternate setting on a previously claimed interface on a device. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.setInterfaceAlternateSetting.handle: The device on which the interface settings are to be set. interface: The interface number to be set. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.setInterfaceAlternateSetting.alternateSetting: The alternate setting to set. callback: The callback to invoke once the interface setting is set.

available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of chrome/chrome_app.ChromeUsb.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
